content.text: 1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes
content.eamr: ( ing-0 "1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes" )

content.text: 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
content.eamr: ( ing-1 "1/2 cup all-purpose flour" )

content.text: 1 egg
content.eamr: ( ing-2 "1 egg" )

content.text: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley
content.eamr: ( ing-3 "1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley" )

content.text: 1/2 teaspoon salt
content.eamr: ( ing-4 "1/2 teaspoon salt" )

content.text: 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg
content.eamr: ( ing-5 "1/4 teaspoon freshly ground nutmeg" )

content.text: 1/4 cup lard or other cooking fat
content.eamr: ( ing-6 "1/4 cup lard or other cooking fat" )

content.text: 0) Place whole potatoes in their skins into a large pot of boiling water; boil for 25 to 30 minutes.
1) Remove potatoes, and discard water.
2) When cool enough to handle, peel potatoes, and place on a lightly floured surface.
3) Mash potatoes with a rolling pin.
4) Place mashed potatoes into a large bowl.
5) Stir in flour, egg, parsley, salt, and nutmeg.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-1 "flour"@11:16 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "egg"@18:21 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "parsley"@23:30 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "salt"@32:36 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "nutmeg"@42:48 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 6) Knead well to form a smooth dough.
7) Then roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch.
8) Cut flattened dough into thin strips, about 1 1/2 inches long.
9) Gently roll out the strips, or stretch them until the ends taper.
10) Set aside for 15 minutes.
11) In a large skillet, heat lard over medium heat.
content.eamr:
( inst-11 / R
	:inform ( ac-11-0 "heat"@24:28 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "lard"@29:33 / FOOD )
		:heat ( temp-11-0 "medium heat"@39:50 / TEMPERATURE )
		:loc ( tool-11-0 "a large skillet"@7:22 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 12) Place the potato strips into the skillet, and fry until golden brown on both sides.
